Reviews.Title: “No room to swing a cat”
Reviews.Author: Mir929
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forward to going to Italy for quite a long time and was really excited when we finally decided to go there. The hotel was booked by our agents, who had never failed us before and I expected a 4 star experience. Before going, of course, I read the trip advisor contributions and was a bit intimidated. We had booked a triple room, which on arrival turned out to be a double room with an additional bed in front of the desk and TV and there was practically no room to even get to my side of the bed. This was the main drawback. The location is great, 50 metres from the Termini where there were a lot of places to eat and a shopping area. The room was cleaned every day, breakfast was OK, although the same every day but they had all we needed. The area is a bit rough in the evening. On our last night there was a big brawl in the Chinese restaurant opposite the hotel and the police had to intervene. Overall it was a nice stay, plenty of things to see. What I didn't like in general was the terrible infrastructure, the Metro is awful - a far cry from the Underground in London. I would recommend the hotel for the location and the nice and friendly staff but this is definitely NOT a 4-star hotel. What I also find absurd is the tourist tax that we had to pay at check-out - 3 more euro per person per night.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Luce for a week and everything went great! The hotel is really close to Termini station and other several public transport options. There are good and cheap restaurants nearby. The staff is helpful and the breakfast was pretty good too! My only critic is that we could sometimes hear other people talking next door, but nothing too disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: blairv149
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at this hotel with my partner. The room was lovely and comfortable and very clean. The hotel staff were very polite and helpful and all spoke very good English. The hotel itself was less than a 5 min walk from the main train terminal. The only fault i had with the hotel was that there was nowhere to sit and get a drink when we got back in the evening, there were also no tea or coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Jumperc
Reviews.Content: My wife and IWent to Rome for our 30th anniversary. We caught the Leonardo express from the airport to the centre and hotel Luce is about 200 yards from the station. It is in an ideal location for the Metro or walking. Because it is near the station, it is easy to find. The staff were always helpful, the rooms comfortable and the breakfast is enough to keep you going. There are plenty of restaurants nearby offering reasonably priced menus, I'd recommend the fixed priced menus

Reviews.Title: “A nice central location”
Reviews.Author: naterbox
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated a stone's throw away from Termini, which is the main train station, the bus terminus and where the Metro lines cross. There are plenty of places to eat nearby, covering all price ranges. The staff on reception are very friendly, speak perfect English, and do their best to sort out queries regarding sightseeing, transport, etc. The hotel is clean, the furnishings are old fashioned. The wardrobes are weird, incorporated into the headboard. The room (207) was small, with only one chair. The air conditioning was not very efficient, but better than nothing. My husband had a problem finding a news channel in English, but finally managed to find one on our last day. I'm, surprised at the 4 star rating considering there is a very limited choice for breakfast, which is the only meal they serve. There is only one person to clear the tables, replenish the cold buffet and wash up. She doesn't understand much English. The coffee in the machine is undrinkable, so we stuck to tea.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star? Hahaha!”
Reviews.Author: Conor W
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Stayed 3 Nights (more than enough) Sept 11-13 2011 Twin room with breakfast. Room 209. The facts: NOT a 4 Star.....2 at most....and I am not exaggerating. Rooms are small....real small. NO NATURAL LIGHT COMING INTO OUR ROOM!! The staff dont care. Rude and uninterested. Breakfast is woeful. (Maybe its all like this in Italy) The elevator fits 3 people in it...WITHOUT luggage. Old-fashioned. Wi-fi only in the lobby...for this ''4 star'' No tea/coffee making facilites in room (maybe thats an Italian thing, I dont know) Loads of Sky channels IF YOU CAN UNDERSTAND ITALIAN!! 2 English channles- Sky & BBC news Wardrobes are about 3 feet off the ground Bed and pillows were hard Shower is tiny; I banged my elbows many times Most unromantic hotel ever. Our Stay: I hope I remember all the details...anyway I'll give it a go... When we arrived the desk guy was taking a personal call....he continued this personal call for the entire duration of us trying to check-in...no manners, no greeting....asked for our passports...after a couple of mins he just said 'Second floor', gave me the key, and said '10 minutes'....as in 'I will be off the phone in 10 minutes, go to your room and I'll photocopy your passports and you can get them later'. We were not comfotable with the fact our passports were with him, so we waited instead of going to our room while this guy talked and talked, laughed and joked with whomever he was talking to.....he even went outside! Then a hotel maid came, and i asked her. they guy came over and mumbeled something in Italian, obviously pissed off he had to do some work. OTHER RANDOM EVENTS: After our early morning flight we needed some rest. So we slept after unpacking. After about 1 hour of sleeping we heard the door unlocking, it woke us up, it was the maid!! She was coming into the room, just as I got to the door! This HAPPENED AGAIN on our last day! At about 10am! NEVER NEVER AGAIN WILL I STAY HERE. I do not reccommend it for anything other than location.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good base for sight seeing.”
Reviews.Author: Ebbalow
Reviews.Content: Room was so small it was funny. Bed clothes were clean but well worn. Breakfast was very basic but ok. Staff friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Surely not one of the best hotels in Rome - even if ****”
Reviews.Author: gitiRoma
Reviews.Content: An agency chose this hotel for my colleagues of an international meeting in Roma, but the only fact they were satisfied with was the pisition (next to the central railway station). A four star hotel worth absolutely not more than three, rooms ok but tiny, insignificant breakfast, general atmosphere quite retro. You can find better.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with no facilities.”
Reviews.Author: ronny20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance from Termini station in a safe area. The hotel rooms are small but clean. The shower is very small. The hotel lacks any bar or extras. European b&b only. Breakfast is very basic and limited. Again clean but don't expect to see any staff if it runs low. The local restaurants are fair priced and hospitable. Tip. Station has a supermarket which offers food at half the price of local outlets. Water is €.60 compaired to €2-3 elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, shame about the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lucy071175
Reviews.Content: This hotel benefits from a great location. It being our first visit to Rome we were unsure of the best area in which to stay so we went with the travel agents recommendation of being near the Termini station. He was right in that the location was great for exploring every part of Rome. We were also worried that the area might be noisy but it really wasn't, in fact once the windows were closed and even with the air con unit going we slept like babies! The room although small was clean and had all the necessary amenities. It was cleaned daily, towels changed and basic mini bar restocked. Breakfast was ok. Basic but fine as we filled ourselves up on Rome's other culinary delights whilst out and about. The one thing that really lets this hotel down is its staff!! They could not even raise a smile let alone engage in conversation. My boyfriend had learnt some Italian prior to our trip and was eager to try this out but gave up when all he was greeted with was the odd grunt. I'm just glad that we didn't need urgent help or advice as who knows the response we would have got! Any recommendation that I might give would be based solely on location and certainly not on service. An ok hotel but definitely not 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough.”
Reviews.Author: pandorasbox06
Reviews.Content: All we did in the hotel was shower and sleep so I wasn't bothered about the small room. It was a lovely clean room and felt very traditional yet had everything you'd need. The best thing about this hotel is it's location. Close to the termini which is basically the centre of Rome, all lines direct here. It's easy accessible and has a lovely traditional restaurant on the street. The only thing is at night this area does become a little rough.. a lot of homeless people sleep near the train station in the Summer but we never had any problems, there are homeless people in all cities. The staff were very friendly and helped us out loads. The breakfast was nice enough if you like croissants and juice. Overall a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star but clean!”
Reviews.Author: Flukey12
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short break at this hotel. Starting with the positives the room and hotel were clean, towels changed daily, breakfast was ok and the water was always hot. However, I would not say this hotel is 4 star. The rooms are small, dark and you can hear everything in neighbouring rooms- above and below! There is no facility for making a hot drink in the room, which would be less of a problem if the hotel had a bar- but it doesn't. There is no area to sit and relax other than in your room and I guarantee you will not want to spend much time in there. I understand that your in Rome and won't want to spend time in the hotel but the star rating alludes to this hotel being better than it actually is. 3 star would be a far better reflection and create a more realistic expectation.

Reviews.Title: “A very good for touristic needs”
Reviews.Author: JuliettaR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Luce hotel for 3 days in April during our touristic trip. Room was a really small, but nice designed and a very clear, with king-size comfy bed. Bathroom is enough spacious, bath-show cabin is a small, everything worked. Towels were changed every day; soap, shampoo refilled daily as well. Breakfast is a standard continental breakfast in Rome: jam, toasts, muesli, thin sliced cheese and ham, croissants and a very good coffee! It was enough for us to start a new day before to meet Rome sights. Hotel location is perfect, not in the center (25 min walk from Colosseum), but in 3 minutes walk away from the metro and railway station. Hotel is a good choice for touristic needs at reasonable price. Would be good to get a free Wi-Fi here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: westie007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fairly small but friendly and polite staff who could speak good english. The rooms were quite small as stated in previous reviews but unless planning to actually move into the room what more do you need? Beds were comfy and shower facilities were always nice and hot. Breakfast was only small selection but plenty for what you needed. Hotel was 2 mins walk from Roma Termini which was great location to jump on the Metro and go to the various sites in Rome. We used the Metro every day and found it very useful being so close after all the walking!! you will appreciate it. Overall, lovley small hotel if you are goin to Rome not wanting to spend a fortune. Didnt take away from the beauty of the city at all. Would deffinately stay here again when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean Hotel in a good location to visit Rome - but more a three star rather than the four star it is listed as”
Reviews.Author: OlbasUk
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay here. The rooms are clean if a little on the small side. Good bathroom and decent comfortable bed. No Air con in the bedrooms so when the windows were open it was rather noisy at times. Breakfast very basic but OK. (except for the coffee!) Excellent helpful, English speaking reception staff. The location is fine, just around the corner from the Termini station, where you can get the shuttle to the Airports or buses to all the major sights. We also easily walked into the centre of Rome on two occassions. Three or four good resturants/bars around the hotel BUT avoid going to the Trattoria Gemma Alla Lupa in the next road to the hotel - awful food, terrible service and they rip you off over the wine prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel located in fine seat and the close personnel”
Reviews.Author: PazzaB
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. The close personnel and a good breakfast. Little bit small numbers, but always pure bed and always fresh toilet accessories and towels. Very close to Train station Termini and the subway. It is convenient to reach any seat interesting you. Around it is a lot of small restaurants .When I shall in Rome necessarily I shall lodge in this hotel. Thanks for fine rest!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeff_london2010
Reviews.Content: Not really a 4 star by international standards. The rooms are quite small and there are no public rooms apart from a breakfast area. However, it is a great base for touring Rome if you are just looking for a reasonably priced comfortable room with breakfast facilities. The area is not the most salubrious but it is within 2 minutes walk of the main railway, metro station and the airport shuttle bus and also within reasonable walking distance of most of the main sights. Breakfast is reasonable and there is a little shop next door with most basic needs. All in all a good budget hotel. Will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: korden
Reviews.Content: Small and cozy hotel Luce is a short walk from the central railway station Termini. The rooms have everything necessary for comfortable rest after a busy day. Rooms are decorated in a beautiful old Italian style. Inside the rather large wardrobes and free safe. The main architectural monuments of Rome are in walking vicinity. The hotel is very clean, breakfast is modest, but not to stay hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Small and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: olbga
Reviews.Content: The hotel has pleased us with its location near the Termini Station and all attractions. The hotel is very small, really small number, but everything worked properly, everything was clean. The rooms are nice. We walked all the time, so little room for the night we are not strained. At breakfast, walked only my friend, I already eat breakfast later. He said that breakfast is very good. The hotel is a bit pricey for its service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & freindly”
Reviews.Author: UKAID
Reviews.Content: Whilst hotel doesn't compare to UK 4* it is very clean and comfortable. The hotel has everything you need for a short stay. Location is good for exploring the sites of rome. A nice restaurant is located next door. The airport drop off point is 1 minutes walk from the hotel. All the staff were extremely helpful and had excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: liyirna
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, small and modest, but doesn't leave bad impressions. Not very attractive neighbourhood, but location is convinient. Staff's friendly, breakfast's simple but satisfactory. Everything's clean. Only flaw I can remember is thin walls - you can hear sounds from nextdoor room's bath very clearly. And rooms are small, so if you are a 'big' person - think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: asimalisyed
Reviews.Content: Yea I agree with other people that the rooms are very very small, but the location of the hotel is ideal in the sense that you will be in the center of the city and very near to historic place like colosseum, trvi fountain, etc. break fast is fair but what i like the most is the hospitality. I forgot to bring the can opener from home and could'nt find in the market in rome than the lady at the reception went with us in super market and helped us to find the can opener , it was a great HELP!!! thanks "Marialla". I personlly like the hotel. Asim Ali Pakistan

Reviews.Title: “3 stars is a maximum for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yanana
Reviews.Content: The room was really small, we've never seen such a tiny room before. Though they tried to decorate it in old italian style with gold colour and mirrors:) Breakfast was moderate - flakes, coffee, some bread, cheese and salami. Location was good for us - close to Termni station and a 20 min walk distance from main sightseengs. But the territory itself that is close to the station is not very nice, a lot of strange people there! Also we saw a cockroach in our room!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok to stay here”
Reviews.Author: markil
Reviews.Content: I think it is not a 4* hotel as it is positioned (except maybe the interior) but we spent quite a good time there. Unfortunately, not all the staff speak english. :(

Reviews.Title: “CRAMMED”
Reviews.Author: benster39
Reviews.Content: I hateed how the rooms were so small!!! im a little heavy and i felt a wee bit clostrofobic in there. i did how ever get thrown into a room with a balcony and no roommate (after a mix up in rooms)! over all i liked it exept for the lack of room!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: NotDeadYet
Reviews.Content: Eight of stayed there for two nights in late october. Good clean rooms with aircon. Good breakfast facilities. Right next to Terminus so great for metro,Tour buses and everything else. 100 yards from terravision coach drop off for Ciampino. Would and have recommended this hotel to friends. Restaurant next door was great value with friendly staff . A Presto!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: Nicat06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Luce from Sept 10th to Sept 14th 2006. The hotel is based on Via Magenta near to the Roma Termini so the area is not the prettiest in Rome but is fantastic to get to all the sites which I would highly recommend if you only have a few days in Rome. The reception area has marble/marble effect floors and is very bright and clean. The reception desk staff were very friendly and spoke good English. We stayed in Room 113 and I cannot fault it at all. The room was small, but perfectly adequate for your needs as a base. It was decorated in green and gold which gave it an "oldy worldy" effect. It had a double bed with wardrobe space to the sides and plenty of hangers and bedside tables with draws. There was a FREE safe in one of the wardrobes which was a bonus as many other European hotels charge for this service. It had a desk with another draw and a fridge with complementary Cokes and water when we arrived. There were 2 mirrors in the room which gave it more light. There was a television but the only channels we could receive were Italian but to be honest, we were too tired to watch anything anyway! The room was air conditioned and worked throughout our stay which was a relief because it was very hot in Rome. The bathroom was big enough and consisted of basin, toilet, bedet (not sure if you spell like this) and shower cubicle. The water in the shower was very warm and could be controlled easily. The water didn't drain away as quickly as it should but we never flooded so it wasn't a problem. The breakfast was typical of a continental breakfast which I have never been a fan of. Being English, eating ham and bread in a morning has always felt strange! There were some cereals and yoghurts and best of all fruit which we took out for snacks during the day. The coffee from the machine was awful but juice was available. Breakfast is served 7 till 9 which gives plenty of time to grab a bite before heading out for the day. I would stay in this hotel again for a short stay. The price was very reasonable, the staff very friendly and the location was excellent. Perhaps if I was staying in Rome longer than 5 days, I may choose something that was a little bigger. Its a thumbs up from me anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Robert51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in this hotel. The location is excellent. The hotel is clean and the staff friendly. There is not a great selection for breakfast - (bread rolls, cheese, ham, cereals, coffee) but there is always plenty to eat and it gave us a good start for the day. The room was small but had air conditioning. When you are in Rome you do not want to spend time in a hotel room. The price for B&B was £50 per night for the two of us - excellent value for an air conditioned room in Rome. The hotel is two minutes walk from Termini Station and hence two minutes from the Metro and Buses that will take you to any location in Rome. (For example Bus No 64 will bring you from Termini to the Vatican and it runs every 6 minutes.) Termini Station is not only a train station but also a shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant experience @ hotel luce”
Reviews.Author: rosetodelgi
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Hotel Luce for 6 nights from June 26- July 2, 2006 under the Jetaway package flight/hotel accomedation special with SKYSERVICE AIRLINES/ALBA TOURS (TORONTO). My experience at the hotel to put it mildly was outright terrible. Immediately upon entering my hotel room, I knew at the very first moment that my stay at the hotel would not be a pleasant one. First off... The air-conditior did not work. Prior to me booking this Jetaway tour package my travel agent assured me that this hotel would have a working air conditioner. My travel agent did his homework by calling the tour operator (alba) and getting confirmation from them. However, not once during our stay at hotel LUCE was the air conditioner in working order. The staff/employees at the front desk apparently made it quite obvious they have their lines rehersed as what to stay to their clential. Their response was simply that the air condition was broken. In fact, one member of the staff thought he could convience me that indeed the air con was on and that I was simply mistaken. There was no way in hell it was in working order, as no cold air was coming out of the ceiling vent. The weather in Rome at the time was over 30 celisus. It was very difficult to sleep and long sleepless night were the norm. Many other hotel guest too were experiencing the same problems. Often, as I waited in line for my room key, I overheard guest complaining to the hotel employee. One guest got so irrated (I don't blame her) that she verbally fought with with the front desk worker causing so much commotion that he threated to call the police. Similarly, one night the front desk clerk informed me in a rude sarcastic nasty tone (in english) "i don't speak english ... speak to me in Italian". It surprised him after I replied back to him in Italian as he had no clue I spoke it fluently. Secondly, the bathroom shower is not suitable for those tall, overweight, pregnant or have a physical disability. I am average weight and found it very difficult to take a shower as the stall was extremely tight. The water also took a lot of time to drain as it was clogged. I would bet my dad's signed Babe Ruth baseball card that they haven't cleared/cleaned the drain in years. Unfortunately for me once without knowing my less then 5 minute shower would turn into water overflowing and flooding all over the bathroom floor trailing into the bedroom area. Immediately the front desk attendent became notified but he didn't seem to care one bit as he simply told me to speak to somebody in the morning. The hotel rooms were also very small in size. There was hardly any space to store personal belongings. My bed too broken as the mattress was caving in. Unfortunately, all the above negative aspects about the hotel wasn't at all my biggest worry. The morning after my first night at the hotel I was reaching for my shoes I placed under my bed. As I grabbed for them, there I few feet away was a dead mouse. I was so disguested and morified. My bedroom likely had not been occupied for sometime before I arrived. Therefore cleaning services didn't feel necessary to check up on the room. Although the hotel staff were made aware of the dead mouse under my bed there were unable to move me into another hotel room because they claimed that the all double rooms were fully booked. They refused to place be into a triple room because I did not pay for one. I couldn't not believe my ears! Moreover, the hotel staff didn't bother to deliver adequate consumer service as they had the mentality that I like the majority of the other hotel guest had prepaid our air/hotel package rate. I would not recommend this hotel even to my worst enemy. The customer service was non existant and the sight of the hotel room was just so sickening. Please avoid this hotel if possible. For those potenital SKYSERVICE VACATIONS Jetaway customers, make sure that the hotel selected for the air/hotel package deal isn't LUCE.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves a Lot to be Desired”
Reviews.Author: Lococutus
Reviews.Content: The star rating on the hotel plaque states 4 stars. The package we took says 3 stars. Our rating - 2 stars. The Continental breakfast was the same every morning and terrible. They need a new instant coffee dispensing machine as well. Leaks all over. The menu never changed and the waitress ran around as if to get rid of us as soon as possible. The staff, never ever smiled in the 11 days we were there. When asked how to get to places, they did not know or didn't care to share the information. The shower stall drains are plugged and fill with water to overflowing. No wash cloths were ever given and they should reconsider the company that does their laundry, because the vinegar odour of the linen is unpleasant. We stayed for 11 days and when we left, they didn't even wish us a pleasant journey home, or asked us how our stay was, or thanked us or anything. In fact the receipt was handed to us without so much as a goodbye, thanks for staying. I don't know how the other hotels in this Marghera chain are but if they are all like this, book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a group of three women travelling, so we occupied a triple room at the Hotel Luce for the last night of our trip (we returned to Rome to fly out the next morning from Fiumicino). The one redeeming quality of this hotel was that the lobby was ok and the staff was very nice. The room we were put in was extemely small, especially for having three beds in the room. We had to push all of the beds together just to store our luggage and to walk around. Upon arrival, we tried to put on the air conditioning -- it did not work. We also tried to turn on the TV -- again, didn't work. We went downtstairs to see if, perhaps, there was a problem, and were told that the air conditioning does not go on until 8pm, and the TV is only available from 7am until 9am to watch the morning programs. The shower drain did not work, so you needed to shut off the water about two minutes through the shower, and wait for the drain to go down then quickly rinse before it filled up again. Because the air conditioning didn't work, we needed to leave the windows open -- but we were uncomfortable doing so because the balconies from the next-door building were so close that someone could have climbed right into the room. We are not very picky tourists, but this hotel was really just sub-par. We stayed in other hotels in the same area on other nights, and they were far superior to the accomodations at the Luce. Perhaps I would recommend this hotel to someone who would never be in the room during the vacation, or who did not care if certain amenities were only available at certain times. However, there are many other hotels in the same area of town for the same price, which are far superior in room size and have amenities available at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Rome amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited Rome and stayed at Hotel Luce. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful. We were very close to the Termini which was great and very close to four restaurants, one which was a cantonese and was very good and reasonable in price. We both found the City to be marvellous and the hotel was excellent We will definitely be going back and will stay at Hotel Luce.

Reviews.Title: “We were well pleased with the Hotel Luce”
Reviews.Author: Viragored
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2006 for four nights. Our room was as small as we expected, but clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was fine and the location good. The room had a double bed that we found comfortable, with just enough room to walk round it. There was ample hanging space, a TV on a dressing table and a mini-bar or fridge (we didn't open it to see what it really was). The bathroom had a shower (no bath) with terrific flow and a lever to set the temperature to whatever you fancied. As well as the wash basin and toilet there was a bidet. The good size mirror above the basin had good lighting on it, too. There was a problem with the shower tray - it wouldn't drain properly. Mindful of an earlier report of difficulties with the staff, we wondered what would happen when we reported it. The helpful receptionist took a note and it was fixed by the time of our next shower. Breakfast is plain continental, but there is a good choice including cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurt, and rolls with preserves, cheese and ham. Drinks include coffee, chocolate, tea and fruit juices (also from a machine that seems to mix them from powder - not the best feature of the breakfast). You can eat as much or as little as you want. The hotel is just a block from Termini station and excellently situated for walking to many of the essential sights of Rome. It's convenient for the Metro trains, buses and trams that all go from Termini. We travelled to Rome by easyJet and used the Terravision bus to get to and from the aiport. The bus drops off at Termini, just a short walk from the hotel. There are dozens of restaurants within a ten minute walk of the hotel. The largest selection is the other side of Termini, where there are probably twenty or thirty in the neighbouring streets. We were happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ALZI
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night stay at the Luce and for the price I paid (£36 a night) found it to be terrific value for money. The rooms are slightly small but are spotlessly clean and even include a bidet. The rates include a buffet breakfast whilst not that varied certainly kept me going for most of the day. Another major plus point is it's location - literally round the corner from Termini station for the underground and tour buses. Do not be put off by the Termini area's dodgy reputation - as a lone traveller I did not feel at all threatened. There were a few beggars and people selling their wares but they were harmless and were to be seen throughout the city. I flew in with Ryanair and the drop off/pick up point is at a couple of minutes walk highly convenient. The Colosseum and Roman Forum for example are only approximately 15 minutes walk away down Via Cavour. Also there are plenty of restaurants and cafes adjacent inluding a Cantonese directly opposite and a couple of Italian ones on both corners of the street of which I tried and both had decent food and were reasonably priced. Now there were some minor quibbles which I have to knock a point off for. Both the coffee and juices came out of a machine - coffee fair enough but at least they could have provided the cheap carton juice. On the whole the breakfast was a bit limited - white rolls, ham, yoghurt, cheese, cake !! Regarding the rooms the shower space was slightly cramped and the wardrobe rail very high - and I'm six foot tall. I could have done with more sheets on the bed taking into account it was January. Also could have done with an English speaking TV channel for news etc. To summarise then this hotel was exactly as I expected and fulfilled my basic obligations of cleanliness and location.

Reviews.Title: “stay away from this one”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is certainley located close to the train station, and within walking distance of many landmarks. The room was clean although small, and there is a great restaurant on the corner. The food at the restaurant is superb, and the wait staff marvellous. They are the only good things about this hotel. The staff are very unfriendly and not at all helpful. We are travelling back to Rome but are avoiding this hotel and rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent, the manager was the most helpful person you could meet and the location is (not pretty) but perfect for going anywhere in rome. Just a street away from the Termini station, the only one with both metro lines. loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: Louise Aherne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Luce while attending our friends wedding on Via National. The location was perfect as it was within walking distance to this main street as well as been beside the main termini train and bus station. This was perfect as we flew into Campino airport and the feeder bus dropped us at the main station. For our return trip we flew from Da Vinci airport which is also only a short train ride from termini station. The hotel itself was basic but the staff were very friendly and had no problem suggesting restaurants or ordering taxis. The breakfast was a cold buffet but had everything from a selection of juices, tea's and coffees to a wide selection of breads, chesses, ham, spreads, cereals and fresh fruit. The bedrooms are probably the only area that could require some improvement. Although they were clean and in plenty supply of towels. They were very small which is why I feel that the accommodation is really only suitable for weekend passengers or passengers staying a minimum number of days as there is very little storage room. However saying that, the rooms were clean and the bed comfortable. Considering the very reasonable cost of this hotel and its central location I would have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone. It's also important to note that hotels in Rome don't supply irons so you may want to bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Oke”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Close to station; but no noise of it Small rooms, but big enough. And very important: Clean.! By train/bus/metro or a walk the center of Roma is close. Nice people.

Reviews.Title: “bad choice”
Reviews.Author: sohersu
Reviews.Content: far from city center, near train station, pretty dirty, small, not really helpful people, wouldn't go back.
